TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TableStyle extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style

Docs.summary: Represents the style for the control and some Web Parts.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableStyle> class is used to represent the style for a table control. It encapsulates the properties that control the appearance of a table and can be applied to multiple table controls to provide a common appearance.
You can specify an image to display in the background of the table by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableStyle.BackImageUrl%2A> property. The amount of spacing between the cells of a table is controlled by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableStyle.CellSpacing%2A> property. The spacing between the contents of a cell and the cell border is specified using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableStyle.CellPadding%2A> property. You can specify whether cell borders are displayed by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableStyle.GridLines%2A> property. The horizontal alignment of the table in relation to other elements on the Web Forms page is indicated by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableStyle.HorizontalAlign%2A> property.
> [!NOTE] > This class is primarily used by control developers.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableStyle> object and then uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.ApplyStyle%2A> method to apply it to a generated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> object.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URL of an image to display in the background of a table control.
Docs.value: The URL of an image to display in the background of a table control. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableStyle.BackImageUrl%2A> property to specify the URL of an image to display in the background of the table control.
> [!NOTE] > The image will be tiled if it is smaller than the table. Similarly, the image is cropped if it is larger than the table.
The value of this property is stored in view state.

Docs.exception: The URL of the background image was set to .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int CellPadding { get; set; }
.property instance int32 CellPadding

public: virtual property int CellPadding { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.CellPadding : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the amount of space between the contents of the cell and the cell's border.
Docs.value: The distance (in pixels) between the contents of a cell and the cell's border. The default is , which indicates that this property is not set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableStyle.CellPadding%2A> property to control the spacing between the contents of a cell and the cell's border. The padding amount specified is added to all four sides of a cell.
All cells in the same column of a data listing control share the same cell width. Therefore, if the content of one cell is longer than the content of other cells in the same column, the padding amount is applied to the widest cell. All other cells in the column are also set with this cell width.
Similarly, all cells in the same row share the same height. The padding amount is applied to the height of the tallest cell in the row. All other cells in the same row are set with this cell height. Individual cell sizes cannot be specified.
The value of this property is stored in view state.

Docs.exception: The specified distance is set to a value less than .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int CellSpacing { get; set; }
.property instance int32 CellSpacing
Public Overridable Property CellSpacing As Integer
public: virtual property int CellSpacing { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.CellSpacing : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the distance between table cells.
Docs.value: The distance (in pixels) between table cells. The default is , which indicates that this property is not set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableStyle.CellSpacing%2A> property to control the spacing between adjacent cells in a data listing control. This spacing is applied both vertically and horizontally. The cell spacing is uniform for the entire data list control. Individual cell spacing between each row or column cannot be specified.
> [!NOTE] > If you set this property to a value greater than `0` and set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableStyle.GridLines%2A> property to a value that displays the cell borders, a gap is displayed between the borders of adjacent cells. In this situation, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableStyle.CellSpacing%2A> property controls the size of the gap.
The value of this property is stored in view state.

Docs.exception: The specified distance is set to a value less than .

member this.GridLines : System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridLines with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the border between the cells of the table control is displayed.
Docs.value: One of the enumeration values. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableStyle.GridLines%2A> property to specify whether the border between the cells of the data list control is displayed. This property is set with one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridLines> enumeration values. The following table lists the possible values.
|Value|Description| |-----------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridLines.None>|No cell border is displayed.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridLines.Horizontal>|Only the upper and lower borders of the cells in the data list control are displayed.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridLines.Vertical>|Only the left and right borders of the cells in the data list control are displayed.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridLines.Both>|All borders of the cells in the data list control are displayed.|
The value of this property is stored in view state.

Docs.exception: The specified value is not one of the enumeration values.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign HorizontalAlign { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign HorizontalAlign
Public Overridable Property HorizontalAlign As HorizontalAlign

public: virtual property System::Web::UI::WebControls::HorizontalAlign HorizontalAlign { System::Web::UI::WebControls::HorizontalAlign get(); void set(System::Web::UI::WebControls::HorizontalAlign value); };
member this.HorizontalAlign : System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of the table within its container.
Docs.value: One of the enumeration values. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableStyle.HorizontalAlign%2A> property to specify the horizontal alignment of the data list control within its container. This property is set with one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign> enumeration values. The following table lists the possible values.
|Value|Description| |-----------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign.NotSet>|The horizontal alignment is not set.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign.Left>|The table is left justified within its container.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign.Center>|The table is centered within its container.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign.Right>|The table is right justified within its container.|
The value of this property is stored in view state.

Docs.exception: The specified horizontal alignment is not one of the enumeration values.
